resources.string:
jump shift to four- or five-level opposite three of minor; agrees the minor, then interpreted as if already in fit auction. Responses to 3D: 
 4D = [a]to_play[/a] 
 4H = autofit, [a]values_for_5[/a] 
 4S = autofit, [a]keycard_ask[/a]

when they bid 1NT or higher; or we make a raw bid or when we pass opposite partner\'s bid or we redouble or when we make a takeout-double of 1S; in disturbed auction, no [a]relay[/a], no [a]sandpit[/a], no suit-setters and no need to bid hearts before spades or clubs before diamonds - bid longest suit
following 2D compelling [a]relay[/a], or 2C invitational relay and partner does not decline invitation with 2D. Team must bid to at least 3NT or penalise them (even if one of team passes)
something to stop them running a suit, e.g. A or KQ or QJ10. Often used to explore 3NT

called invitational+ in book; gets its name from [a]relay[/a], which has 2 forms: 2C (invitational) and 2D (compelled). Invitational+ combines both, i.e. 23+ TP. After any constructive response, bidding must continue at least until 3 of opener's suit; past that it becomes [a]compelled[/a]

In fit auction, not jump, lowest available side-suit at level 4 is [a]values_for_5[/a]; next suit up (usually 4D) is keycard_ask, asking for aces and trump king; if only 1 side-suit available, that suit is keycard ask, e.g. if we’re playing in spades, then 4NT is keycard ask. 
 +1: 0 or 3 
 +2: 1 or 4 
 +3: 2 or 5
weak hand with long suit

After response to keycard ask, lowest side-suit = queen ask 
 Responses to queen ask (bid lowest suitable bid): 
 * any bid up to and including lowest bid of trump suit = no trump queen 
 * lowest bid of trump suit = no trump queen, no kings that could be mentioned, but something, i.e. king that couldn’t be mentioned 
 any bid above lowest bid of trump suit = trump queen 
 no trumps = no kings that could be mentioned 
 bid of suit other than trumps = king in that suit
now given full description of hand

2C or 2D as a response. Relay is always available to an unlimited hand; never available to limited hand. Relay indicates: 
 * no 4-4 in either major 
 * enough for game (2C, invitational, 25 TP) or nearly enough for game (2D, compelling, 23-24 TP) 
 * now looking for 5-3 fit in a major, or 4-4 fit in minor

* 2D (i.e. after 2C invite) = invitation declined, less than 25 TP; all other bids accept the invitation, so compelled 
 * 2H = 5+ hearts (as 2C/D denies 4-4 major) or 3 if already denied hearts 
 * 2S = 5+ spades or 3 if already denied spades; denies ability to bid hearts 
 * 3NT = to play; no major fit, all suits covered; note: if partner is unlimited and you have a 4+ minor suit, bid 2NT to allow partner to explore for minor fit, and possible slam 
 * 3C/3D = natural, 4+ in suit, can't rebid majors; either strong or skew hand; bid 3C with 4+ in both minors 
 * 2NT = waiting, none of above; limiting to game values, as otherwise would bid a minor or jump in no-trumps

[b]3H/3S[/b] = [a]suit_setter[/a] 
[b]2H/2S[/b] = <5 HCP; 6+ in suit (with 5+ HCP bid 1 of major) 
[b]1H[/b] = 4+ hearts 
[b]1S[/b] = 4+ spades, <4 hearts 
[b]2C/2D[/b] = [a]relay[/a] 23+ TP, no 4+ major 
[b]4C/4D[/b] = [a]suit_setter[/a] 
[b]2NT[/b] = [a]two_choice[/a], no 4+ major, 5+ in both minors, 5-7 HCP 
[b]3C/3D[/b] = 6+ in suit, no 4+ major, 5-7 HCP, [a]raw[/a] 
[b]1NT[/b] = 0-7 HCP, no 4+ major, no {6+ minor and 5-7 HCP} 
[b]pass[/b] = 0-4 HCP (free bid)
jump from 1-level to new suit; special case of [a]raw[/a] bid; 6-card suit, weak, preemptive
hand containing singleton or void

jump shift opposite natural suit bid below 3-level, to another suit not previously shown, that commits us to play at 4-level in partner\'s suit (neutral auction) or agreed suit (fit auction). [b]Meaning:[/b] void or singleton (not A/K/Q) in bid suit and agreeing partner\'s suit; 1st or 2nd round control of other 2 suits (A or Kx); values for at least 4-level (25+ TP); used to test slam potential; forcing.
8 trumps between us and 23 TP

Long, strong suit, not needing support from partner; at least 5 winners in suit. In a neutral auction, not a [a]splinter[/a], not already denied suit, then 3H/3S/4C/4D unilaterally sets the suit (hence fit auction). If compelled or bidder unlimited, then suit-setter is forcing, otherwise not forcing
not forcing; partner happy to play in this contract, but you may bid on
partner to choose from 2 lowest unshown suits

In fit auction, not jump, lowest available side suit at 4-level (usually 4C). We have got enough points and length to bid 5; inviting partner to bid [a]keycard_ask[/a] if strong enough, and if not return to trumps

In a fit auction, 3 of trump suit when compelled or 2NT when non-compelled is a waiting bid; i.e. isn’t adding anything, but partner can’t pass, so asking partner to make the next move. In response to [a]relay[/a], unable to bid a suit
